Key Arguments: The legislation lacks clear definitions for misinformation and disinformation.
The bill could be used by businesses and government to stifle public debate on important social issues.
Historical examples show that truths can be suppressed for commercial advantage.
Industries like tobacco, fossil fuels, and nuclear proliferation could exploit the legislation.
Notable Quotes: A bill such as this one will become a convenient gag used by business and government for stifling public debate of important social issues.
The tobacco industry would have loved legislation such as this.
